ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer
Class ShapeNode

java.lang.Object
  ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.Leaf
      ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.ShapeNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node
public class ShapeNode
extends Leaf

A ShapeNode is a leaf in the GraphSceneManager. This is a node that contains an actual Shape that will be drawn on screen. The shape can also be associated with other ShapeNodes. In addition a ShapeNode stores the Material that contains information about the color and texture that the shape has. It also has a BoundingBox that is mostly used for fast testing for intersection.
If a physics engine is attached to the scene manager a ShapeNode stores information about the corresponding physics node. It contains a Box2DBody, that consists of a physics shape and information about its properties and its position.

Constructor Detail

ShapeNode

public ShapeNode(Shape shape)
Instantiates a new shape node with a given shape.

Parameters:
shape - the shape that will be used for drawing the shape node on the screen

ShapeNode

public ShapeNode(Box2DBody body,
                 float depth)
Instantiates a new shape node if a physics node is passed. It extracts information about the shape type that the physics node contains and builds a 3D representation of it.

Parameters:
body - the corresponding Box2DBody
depth - the depth that might be used if the shape is a box.

updatePositionFromPhysic

public void updatePositionFromPhysic()
Description copied from interface: Node
Reflects the position change of the node back from the physics world. This is used to keep the position of the physics world and the visual world in synchronization.

intersect

public RayShapeIntersection intersect(Ray ray)
Intersects the given ray with the node. Returns an empty RayShapeIntersection if the Node is inactive. Otherwise tests the Bounding Box of the shape for quick access and if it's hit tests against the actual shape.

Parameters:
ray - the ray
Returns:
the intersection that stores information about whether and if where a hit occurred
